title: 2. Reviewing the Challenges in Data Collection and Reporting by Humanitarian Organizations in Armed Conflicts
text: This was the result of my masters thesis at the global health center (CRIMEDIM). The systematic literature review uncovered four main setbacks in the flow of information amongst stakeholders. Details of the project can be view here —

title: 1.Assessing the Variation in the Use of Analgesic in the Elderly
text: This was a thesis project to assess the variation in the use of analgesics in the elderly globally, identify the patient/facility related factors. You can find the project here —

title: Education
text:
Master in Medical Biotechnologies 06 Oct 2022 - 16 Jul 2024
Institution: University of Eastern Piedmont, Novara, Italy - School of medicine: Via Solaroli 17, 28100 - Total CFU: 120
Relevant courses: Big data analysis, Research methods and epidemiological study designs, Functional Genomics, Structural Genomics, Biomedical Statistics. For more about the degree program here -
Bachelor in Biomedical Science 06 Oct 2016 - 10 Aug 2019
Institution: University of Dschang, West region, Cameroon Faculty of medcine and Pharmaceutical Sciences Total CFU: 180
Relevant courses: Epidemiology of Infectious Diseases, Biostatistics, Medical Microbiology.

title: Tamegye Boris Kouchou
text:
is a skilled professional with a Master’s degree in Medical Biotechnologies from the University of Eastern Piedmont, specializing in Public Health. He currently serves as a Data Analyst at the Vercelli Council’s Department of Civil Protection, where he utilizes his proficiency in R, QGIS, and Power BI to analyze environmental safety data and support public health initiatives.
Boris has a strong background in infectious disease research, having studied epidemic outbreaks in conflict zones and conducted health surveys in low resource settings, his prior work as a Community Health Worker in Nigeria further underscores his commitment to public health and community well-being.
Boris aspires to advance research in infectious disease epidemiology and collaborate with NGOs and governmental organizations to address disease dynamics on a global scale. He is recognized for his diligence, independence, and dedication to improving public health research.
